extendedIngredients.name: apricot jam
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup fruit juice sweetened apricot preserves/jam (such as Polaner All Fruit Apricot Spread)
metaInformation: (such as Polaner All Fruit Apricot Spread)

extendedIngredients.name: coconut oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil or coconut oil (melted, if solid)

extendedIngredients.name: wings
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 pounds buffalo wings or whole wings (if whole wings, separate at joint and cut off wingtips for wings and drumettes)

recipes.title: Sticky Baked Wings

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken Wings works really well with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil. Whisk apricot jam, sriracha, soy sauce, and oil to combine. Place chicken wings in a layer on a baking sheet. Baste wings with sauce, flip, and baste on other side. Place in oven and bake for about 25-30 minutes, basting with more sauce a few times while cooking.  Makes about 24 chicken wings.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil.
Whisk apricot jam, sriracha, soy sauce, and oil to combine.
Place chicken wings in a layer on a baking sheet. Baste wings with sauce, flip, and baste on other side.
Place in oven and bake for about 25-30 minutes, basting with more sauce a few times while cooking.  Makes about 24 chicken wings.
